doc.after: Article 25 of the Constitution protects the rights of citizens to practice any religion that they choose.[40] The government also did not establish a state religion.[41] Islam is the predominant religion, practised by approximately ninetyÂ percent of the country's population. The majority of the Muslims in the Gambia adhere to Sunni laws and traditions,[41] while large concentrations follow the Ahmadiyya tradition.[42]
